required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Football Matches on the Emergency Admissions of a Level III Maternity During EURO 2016
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Football Matches on the Emergency Admissions of a Level III Maternity During EURO 2016

brief_summary.textblock:
Attendances at an emergency department (ED) are often considered to depend on different factors such as moonlight, welfare checks, weather, and major sporting events. Data regarding effects of large sporting events on the workload of ED often assessed decreased patient volume, especially male use. Currently, no data are available on the effect of major televised sporting events on obstetrical visits. The aim of this study is to examine whether televised soccer games from a major sporting tournament, (Euro 2016) influence the level of attendance at an obstetrical ED and could have implications for women's welfare.
In the summer of 2016, France hosted the largest European sporting event of the year 2016: the European Football Championships (Euro 2016). A total of 51 games were played over a month, bringing together the biggest European teams. An observational, retrospective study is conducted during this period on the number of emergency visits in a French tertiary Maternity hospital (Maternity of Nancy).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall number of maternity emergencies admissions during EURO 2016 (10June-10July)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of EURO 2016 on 10th July 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of daily admissions and per 2 hours time slot every day from June 10th to July 10th
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of EURO 2016 on 10th July 2016

intervention.intervention_name: Emergency visit in a French tertiary Maternity hospital (Maternity of Nancy)
intervention.description: total number of visits (hospitalizations and consultations)

study_pop.textblock: All patients admitted to emergencies are informed of the protocol and a questionnaire is provided by the care team.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All female patients admitted urgently to the Regional Maternity Hospital between June 10 and July 10, 2016
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal of the patient
- information and understanding impossible
